column4: hello everybody! Maybe somebody can help me to fix a problem: I try to install some programs which need certain packages (eg g++) but I canÂ´t install the packages because there are "unmet dependencies". I tried to manually install the dependencies, no success, even they have deps on some packages where version conflicts occur. Anybody knows how to fix this?
how are you trying to install g++? apt-get should handle all dependencies for you
yes I did use apt-get but as I said there are version conflicts. It rejects to install the package.
pastebin the full output please
I posted the output
where? :)
there should be a new item here in IRC
no, pastebin posts don't get announced automatically, just give us the url
(privat message, whatvever it is called)
can you pastebin the output of apt-get install g++-4.1 and the output of more /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list.d/* | cat
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1345851/ and http://paste.ubuntu.com/1345857/
ah, I got the first command wrong, should be: sudo apt-get install g++-4.4
already wondered... :)
btw, you're using an obsolete, unsupported version of ubuntu, an upgrade is recommended
I know but Ubuntu 10.10 is the only version where my graphics card works as it should
k, then we'll try to keep it working. Any luck with that apt-get? (pastebin please)
there we go: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1345870/
looks like you had updates enabled at some point but not anymore. This is fixable :)
replace the contents of /etc/apt/sources.list with what's on http://pastebin.com/CL2mcCXV
oh ok, but I did update to the newest packages but disabled the option after that that it doesnt bother me with asking each time
you shouldn't disable that, those updates are important
:O I have some updates available, NICE! Sorry for that dump action, I will let the system update now and tell you then...
Thank you very much for your help! It works now, after the update finished I can install all the packages I need. :) You rock!
you're welcome :)
